content: Amiodarone is the most commonly used antiarrhythmic medication for the chronic rhythm control of atrial fibrillation and prevention of ventricular arrhythmias.1 Amiodaroneâ€™s unique pharmacokinetic properties, namely its very long half-life and large volume of distribution, result in prolonged tissue exposure.2 The most common adverse effects involve the lungs, liver, thyroid, and eyes, and require diligent monitoring.3

title: Chronic amiodarone use and the risk of cancer: A systematic review and meta-analysis
